title: 2018-19 Pistons Profile: Zaza Pachulia | Detroit Pistons
snippet: After failing to make the playoffs last season, Pistons owner Tom Gores made the call to change course. Ed Stefanski was hired to run the front office and his first big move was to hire Dwane Casey, reigning NBA Coach of the Year. The roster is set, a new coaching staff and front office is ...

title: Zaza Pachulia - Wikipedia
snippet: On July 15, 2018, Pachulia signed with the Detroit Pistons. On August 29, 2019, Pachulia retired from playing and re-joined the Warriors as a front office consultant in their basketball operations department. He won his third NBA championship after the Warriors defeated the Boston Celtics in ...

title: How Zaza Pachulia has been 'invaluable' for Detroit Pistons
snippet: "Obviously, from the coaching staff and my teammates and the organization, we're not quite where we want to be. To be a part of this building process is great. I can definitely be helpful and that's what I've been doing as a role player." Pachulia, 35, realized the Warriors wouldn't re-sign him after he made just seven cameo appearances in last year's playoffs. The new Pistons regime, led by senior advisor Ed Stefanski and head coach Dwane Casey, valued Pachulia as a veteran leader who could facilitate their efforts to turn the franchise around.
